alert.note: Alert for Clackamas (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 10:38PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Oregon, including the following counties, Clackamas and Multnomah. * WHEN...Until 430 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Stream flow gauges indicate the upper reaches of Johnson Creek in Gresham and Beaver Creek in Troutdale are unusually high. Similarly high flows are likely occurring along other creeks in the area including Clear and Abernathy Creeks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1034 PM PDT, Gauge reports indicate between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the past 24 hours in the general advisory area with 1 to 1.5 inches of rain falling in the last six hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inch are expected over the next 3-6 hours. This additional rain will result in some minor flooding of area creeks. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oregon City, Sandy, Portland, Gresham, Lake Oswego, West Linn, Milwaukie, Wilsonville, Troutdale, Canby, Gladstone, Estacada, Boring, Powellhurst-Centennial, Oatfield, Jennings Lodge, Hazelwood, Clackamas, Happy Valley and Damascus. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
